Trial_Design.evidence: One hundred and forty patients scheduled hysteroscopy under monitored anesthesia care were randomized

Participants.evidence: One hundred and forty patients scheduled hysteroscopy under monitored anesthesia care

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive a bolus of 8 µg·kg −1 , 10 µg·kg −1 , 12 µg·kg −1 , 14 µg·kg −1 intravenous alfentanil or 0.15 µg⋅kg −1 intravenous sufentanil

Objective.evidence: The object of the trial was to determine the median effective dose (ED 50 ) and the 95% effective dose (ED 95 ) of alfentanil

Method_Outcome.evidence: Whether there was loss of response to cervical dilation or not in each patient was recorded

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred and forty patients scheduled hysteroscopy under monitored anesthesia care were randomized

Result_Outcome.evidence: The calculated ED 50 and ED 95 of alfentanil were 9.73 [95% CI 8.57 to 10.56] µg·kg −1 and 15.02 [95% CI 13.57 to 18.12] µg·kg −1 , respectively.

Harms.evidence: The incidence of intraoperative hypotension was lower

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was then registered on January 24, 2024 at the Chinese Clinical Trial Registry
